discourse_list.title: How important is the MKR token to the economic stability of a minimized DAI?

content.content: I’m looking to understand MKR & DAI better by building a really minimized version of DAI as an example (been having a hard time visualizing vat.sol, dog.sol, etc) and I’m wondering if I need to include the MKR token? From a production standpoint, I 100% understand. Governance is a crucial piece to making sure a system like this works, and having a token volatile in price is nice to absorb some of the volatility of the stablecoin (low-vol coin). So I think as a note, I’ll be sure to include how my minimized version would be terrible for production without the MKR token. But from a very minimalistic standpoint - I could make a demo without the MKR token right? A very inflexible contract that would probably have a hard time keeping a peg without the token, especially due to volatility of collateral. Any thoughts?
Look into Rai maybe. They kind of have governance token but it’s ungovernance token supposely

Yeah, I’m taking a look now. Interesting; FLX plays a simpler role than MKR. You stake as the backstop of total failure. So what I’m thinking… is that I leave out the MKR token for now, and make sure to add a note about what DAI and RAI do to make sure the protocol stays solvent. Our minimized version like I mentioned will just be to understand the core module.

Aside from MKR holders voting in governance, MKR token would be the lender of last resort to stabilize the peg. As of today, MKR token is not required to maintain the peg because of previous governance decisions.
Thanks for the context, for now I’ll continue without… and then maybe change at some point idk.

I think starting without $MKR is good enough. The effectiveness of the lender of last resort nature of the $MKRA minting is all to be proven: IMO it won’t behave well at all. I would suggest you start without the $MKR token, it might stimulate conversations about better backstop design.
Ooo - also a great point about the backstops! Thanks again

luca_pro:  The effectiveness of the lender of last resort nature of the $MKRA minting is all to be proven: IMO it won’t behave well at all.   I mean the protocol already did that in Black Thursday in 2020 to fill and it showed it worked
I guess we could aim at something more nuanced than “it works”. But I get your point
